CatDescriptText: Miss Valetta Smiley, dental assistant, 1841 Linton Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "In my areas, it is political leadership.  And the reason is that there is more interest among Negroes in politics, and also because they do not go to church but do vote.  I think that they follow politics because of personal reasons.  The people, I'm talking about, are mostly housewives who do not work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Valetta Smiley wearing dark button down coat with rounded collar, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
